LightingEnvironment.Description: Topics demonstrating features and tools for lighting scenes.
LightingEnvironment.Overview: Efficiently light small enclosed scenes to large worlds with the engine's tools and options. Guides on lighting in Unreal Engine.

NewUE5LightingFeatures.LumenGlobalIlluminationAndReflections: Overview of Lumen's dynamic global illumination and reflections.
NewUE5LightingFeatures.LumenTechnicalDetails: Technical details of using Lumen with ray tracing.

LightingEssentials.FeaturesAndPropertiesOfLights: Overview of properties and features supported by lights.
LightingEssentials.DesigningVisualsRenderingAndGraphics: Rendering subsystem including lighting, shadowing, materials, textures, visual effects, and post-processing.

LightingFeaturesAndTools.EnvironmentalLightWithFogCloudsSkyAndAtm: Tools for building immersive worlds with fog, clouds, sky, and atmosphere lighting.
LightingFeaturesAndTools.LumenGlobalIlluminationAndReflections: Overview of Lumen's dynamic global illumination and reflections.
LightingFeaturesAndTools.MeshDistanceFields: Overview of Mesh Distance Fields features for game development.
LightingFeaturesAndTools.HardwareRayTracingAndPathTracingFeatures: Topics on supported ray tracing and path tracing features.
LightingFeaturesAndTools.Shadowing: Overview of shadowing methods and their properties.
LightingFeaturesAndTools.VirtualShadowMaps: High-resolution shadow techniques for film-quality assets and large dynamically lit worlds.
LightingFeaturesAndTools.ReflectionsEnvironment: Systems for capturing and displaying reflections on surfaces.

LightingToolsAndPlugins.LightingToolsAndPlugins: Collection of tools and plugins for lighting scenes.
LightingToolsAndPlugins.ContactShadows: Using screen space shadowing for shadow contact points.
LightingToolsAndPlugins.CapsuleShadows: Using physics capsules for dynamic soft shadowing of Skeletal Meshes.

General.PostProcessEffects: Effects applied to the whole rendered scene before rendering.
General.VolumetricFog: Overview of volumetric fog and lighting options with Exponential Height Fog Component.

General.UsingBumpOffset: Guide for using the Bump Offset node in materials.

General.HDRIBackdropVisualizationTool: Blueprint tool for product visualization with HDR image projection and real-time lighting and shadowing.

EnvironmentalLight.Description: Components and tools for immersive world lighting with fog, clouds, sky, and atmosphere.
EnvironmentalLight.Overview: Unreal Engine provides components for designers to create immersive worlds with physically based lighting. These tools support fully dynamically lit worlds.

LightMixer.Description: Dockable editor window to add, edit, and reference Directional, Point, Spot, and Rect Lights in your Level.
LightMixer.Benefits: Simplifies and speeds up workflow by having lights available in one location, including components of scene Actors or Blueprints. Use Collections to organize lights.

EnvironmentLightMixer.Description: Dockable editor window to add, edit, and reference environment lighting components for sky, clouds, atmosphere lights, and a sky light.
EnvironmentLightMixer.Benefits: Simplifies and speeds up workflow by having environment lights available in one location.

FogEffects.Description: Useful for ambiance and setting mood with multi-layered and volumetric fog effects.
FogEffects.SkyAtmosphereIntegration: Sky Atmosphere includes scattering and height fog simulation, compatible with Exponential Height Fog.

FogEffectsTopics.ExponentialHeightFog: Overview of the height-based, distant fog system.
FogEffectsTopics.VolumetricFog: Overview of volumetric fog and lighting options with Exponential Height Fog Component.

AtmosphereCloudsAndWorldLightingEffects.Description: Components for Sky Atmosphere, Volumetric Clouds, Directional Lights, and Sky Light work together for dynamically lit large worlds.
Components: Single Sky Light with optional real-time capturing
Sky Atmosphere with its own height fog
Volumetric Clouds with or without a sky dome mesh
AtmosphereCloudsAndWorldLightingEffects.RealTimeCapture: Use keyboard shortcuts with mouse movement to change lighting dynamically.

AtmosphereCloudsAndWorldLightingTopics.SkyAtmosphereComponent: Physically-based sky and atmosphere rendering with time-of-day features and ground-to-space transitions.
AtmosphereCloudsAndWorldLightingTopics.VolumetricCloudComponent: Real-time cloud rendering using volumetric materials.
AtmosphereCloudsAndWorldLightingTopics.HeterogeneousVolumes: Render volume-domain materials that sample from Sparse Volume Textures.

PropertiesReference.VolumetricCloudComponentProperties: Settings and property reference for Volumetric Clouds Component.

MaterialAndSparseVolumeTextureAssets.SparseVolumeTextures: Stores baked simulation data for volumetric media like smoke, fire, and water.

EnvironmentLightMixer.Description: An editor window combining atmospheric lighting components for quick creation and editing.
EnvironmentLightMixer.Overview: Create and edit environment lighting components for sky, clouds, atmosphere lights, and sky lighting in one place. Adjust the level of properties detail.
EnvironmentLightMixer.Opening: Open from Main Menu: Window > Env. Light Mixer.

Interface.Toolbar: Add and configure properties detail in Components Panels.

ComponentsPanels.Description: Lists components available to add to the scene: Sky Light, Atmosphere Lights, Sky Atmosphere, Volumetric Cloud.
ComponentsPanels.PropertiesDetail: Adjust properties shown using Property Details dropdown: Minimal, Normal, Normal+Advanced.

Components: 2x Directional Lights (sun and moon or two suns)

PropertiesDetailLevels.Description: Common and advanced properties for components.

ExponentialHeightFog.Description: Overview of the height-based, distant fog system.
ExponentialHeightFog.Overview: Creates more density in low places and less in high places with smooth transitions. Provides two fog colors for hemispheres.

Usage.AddActor: Select Exponential Height Fog Actor in Place Actors panel under Visual Effects and place in world.
Usage.Positioning: Determines height of fog. Adjust with Fog Height Falloff.

Properties.FogDensity: Global density factor, thickness of fog layer.
Properties.FogHeightFalloff: Controls how density increases as height decreases. Smaller values make transition larger.

SecondFogData.FogHeightFalloff: Height density factor for secondary fog layer.
SecondFogData.FogHeightOffset: Height offset relative to Actor's Z height.

Properties.SkyAtmosphereAmbientContributionColorSca: Modulates Sky Atmosphere component contribution to fog.
Properties.FogMaxOpacity: Maximum opacity of fog, 1 is fully opaque, 0 is invisible.
Properties.StartDistance: Distance from camera where fog starts.
Properties.FogCutoffDistance: Scene elements past this distance will not have fog applied.

InscatteringTexturing.InscatteringColorCubemap: Cubemap for fog color. Overrides Fog Inscattering Color and disables directional inscattering.
InscatteringTexturing.InscatteringColorCubemapAngle: Angle to rotate Inscattering Color Cubemap.
InscatteringTexturing.InscatteringTextureTint: Tint color for quick edits without reimporting cubemap.
InscatteringTexturing.FullyDirectionalInscatteringColorDistanc: Distance at which cubemap should be used directly for Inscattering Color.
InscatteringTexturing.NonDirectionalInscatteringColorDistance: Distance at which average cubemap color is used as Inscattering Color.

DirectionalInscattering.DirectionalInscatteringStartDistance: Start distance from viewer for directional inscattering.

VolumetricFog.Enable: Enable Volumetric Fog. Scalability settings control resolution.

Properties.Emissive: Light emitted by fog. Sky Light is better for most cases.
Properties.StartDistance: Distance from camera where Volumetric Fog starts.
Properties.NearFadeInDistance: Distance over which Volumetric Fog fades in.
Properties.OverrideLightColor: Use Fog Inscattering Color for Sky Light's Volumetric Scattering Color and Directional Inscattering Color.

FeaturesUsage.SecondaryFogLayer: Add a second fog layer with Second Fog Data properties for better control.

Performance.RenderingCost: Similar to two layers of constant density height fog with optimization using Start Distance. Can reduce rendering cost by 50% or more.

HeterogeneousVolumes.Description: Render volume-domain materials that sample from Sparse Volume Textures.
HeterogeneousVolumes.Overview: Supports real-time and Path Tracer rendering of static or animated sparse volume texture materials.
UsageWorkflow: Import a VDB to create a Sparse Volume Texture asset.
Set up a Volume-domain material sampling an SVT asset.
Add a Heterogeneous Volume Actor to the scene and assign an SVT material.

Steps: Drag and drop the VDB into the Content Browser.
Use the Import button in the Content Browser.
ImportingVDBFiles.Details: Option to import static or animated VDB files. Animated VDBs require only one file from the sequence.

SVTMaterialSetup.Details: Set up a material using the Sparse Volume Texture Sample node. Use with Heterogeneous Volumes, Volumetric Fog, Volumetric Clouds, or any volume-based material. Use the sample SVT material in Engine > Engine Materials.

Steps: Search and add a Heterogeneous Volume actor in the Place Actors panel.
Assign an SVT material to the actor in the Details panel.
For animated VDBs, enable Playing and Looping in the Animation section.

Materials.Element[N]: Material assignment slot for a volume-based material sampling an SVT.

Volume.PivotAtCentroid: Moves pivot to center of volume.

Animation.Looping: Repeats animated SVT from start to end frame.

SparseVolumeTextureStreaming.IssueBlockingRequests: Blocks streaming system for real-time playback.

Lighting.StepFactor: Adjusts step-size of ray marching integrator.
Lighting.ShadowBiasFactor: Adjusts initial voxel bias for shadows.
Lighting.LightingDownsampleFactor: Adjusts volume resolution of lighting cache.

Steps: Set Default RHI to DirectX 12.
Enable Support Hardware Ray Tracing.
Enable Path Tracing.
Optional: Enable Niagara Fluids plugin.
Create a new Niagara Fluid in the Content Browser.
Select New system from a template or behavior example.
Choose an example from the 3D Gas list.
Set Loop Behavior to Infinite and Loop Duration to under 5 seconds.
Compile and save the Niagara Fluid asset.
Place the Niagara Fluid in the scene.
Enable path tracer support with r.PathTracing.HeterogeneousVolumes 1.

ConsoleVariables.r.PathTracing.HeterogeneousVolumes: Enables path tracing of heterogeneous volumes.
ConsoleVariables.r.HeterogeneousVolumes.OrthoGrid.MaxBott: Sets memory limit for bottom-level voxel grid.
ConsoleVariables.r.HeterogeneousVolumes.OrthoGridShadingR: Sets shading rate of voxel grid.
ConsoleVariables.r.HeterogeneousVolumes.FrustumGrid.MaxBo: Sets memory limit for bottom-level voxel grid.
ConsoleVariables.r.HeterogeneousVolumes.FrustumGrid.Shadi: Sets shading rate of frustum-aligned voxel grid.
ConsoleVariables.r.HeterogeneousVolumes.FrustumGrid.Depth: Sets depth slices of frustum-aligned voxel grid.

ProjectSettings.HeterogeneousVolumes: Enable rendering with heterogeneous volumes subsystem.
ProjectSettings.ShadowCasting: Enable shadow casting onto the environment.
ProjectSettings.CompositeWithTranslucency: Enable compositing with heterogeneous volumes when rendering translucency.

RealTimeRendering: More complete support in Path Tracer.
PathTracer: Blocky or blurry volumes due to shading rate.
Missing voxels if memory limit exceeded.

LightMixer.Description: Editor window displaying all lights in a scene for rapid inspection and editing.
LightMixer.Overview: Dedicated interface for lighting, allowing artists to isolate lights, change visibility, and group lights. Complements the Environment Light Mixer.

Interface.Open: Open from Editor main menu: Window > Light Mixer.

Functions: Sync Lights in Level with Light Mixer.
Toolbar.SyncSelection: Synchronizes Light selection in Light Mixer with Outliner selection.

Options: Toggle folder visibility in Light Mixer panel.
Rebuild List to refresh Light Mixer.

ManagingLights.FilterLights: Use Search Filter to filter lights by name.
SelectMultipleLights: Hold Ctrl to individually select Lights.
Click one Light, hold Shift, and select another to select a group.
ManagingLights.EditMultipleLights: Change shared attributes of multiple Lights at once.
ManagingLights.LightVisibility: Toggle visibility of Lights using the Eye icon.
ManagingLights.IsolateLights: Isolate selected Lights using the Solo option.

Methods: Use Add button to add directional, spot, point, or rectangular area lights.
Drag light types from the menu into the scene.

Functions: Cut, Copy, Paste, Duplicate, Delete, Rename Lights.
Replace Selected Actors With another Light or Actor.
Reparent Lights using Drag and Drop or Attach To.

LightCollections.Description: Organize lights into non-destructive user-defined sets.
CreatingCollection: Select lights, right-click, and click Select or Add Collection.
Name the collection and press Enter.
LightCollections.ViewingCollection: Click collection name under Search to view.
LightCollections.AddingToCollection: Select lights, right-click, and choose from existing collections.
LightCollections.RemovingFromCollection: Select lights, right-click, and uncheck collections to remove.
ManagingCollections: Right-click collection tab to Delete, Duplicate, or Rename.

AddRemoveAttributes: Hover over Column header and click Overflow Menu icon.
Enable/disable checkboxes next to Light attributes.
CustomizingLightMixer.LightsAsComponents: Lists and displays Lights that are components of other Actors and Blueprints.

SkyAtmosphereComponent.Description: Physically-based sky and atmosphere rendering with time-of-day features and ground-to-space view transitions.
SkyAtmosphereComponent.Overview: Flexible enough to create Earth-like or exotic extraterrestrial atmospheres. Provides light scattering through participating media, realistic sunrise and sunset, and aerial perspective.
Features: Two atmospheric Directional Lights for sun disk representation.
Sky color varies with sun altitude.
Control over scattering and fuzzy settings.
Simulates curvature of the world for transitions from ground to sky to space.

Steps: Place a Sky Atmosphere component in the scene.
Place a Directional Light and enable Atmosphere Sun Light.
Set Atmosphere Sun Light Index for multiple Directional Lights.
Place a Sky Light to capture Sky Atmosphere.

Shortcuts: Right Ctrl + L for Directional Light index 0.
Right Ctrl + L + Shift for Directional Light index 1.

SkyAtmosphereModel.Description: Simulates light scattering with Mie and Rayleigh scattering for realistic sky colors during time-of-day transitions.
SkyAtmosphereModel.RayleighScattering: Interaction of light with smaller particles, giving the sky its blue color during the day and red at sunset.
SkyAtmosphereModel.MieScattering: Interaction with larger particles, causing haze and forward scattering.

RayleighScale: Decreased scattering (10x less dense than Earth).
Increased scattering (10x more dense than Earth).

ArtisticDirection.AerialPerspectiveScale: Scales distances from view to surfaces for thicker appearance from high altitude.
ArtisticDirection.HeightFog: Sky Atmosphere component can create height fog without Exponential Height Fog component.

SkyRenderingOptions.Description: Sky and aerial perspective rendered using ray marching with various lookup tables (LUTs).

PlanetaryAtmospheres.Description: Create planetary atmospheres viewed from space.

Options: Planet Top at Absolute World Position

Transmittance.Description: Light transmittance optimized for ground-level views. Enable per pixel transmittance for correct appearance in space.

GroundToSpace.Description: Optimized for ground-level scenes but supports transitions from ground to space. Disable optimizations with console commands if needed.

Properties: Enable Per Pixel Atmosphere Transmittance for accurate shadowing in space.

VisualizationDebugging.Description: Real-time visualization of atmosphere settings with Hemisphere View, Time-of-Day Preview, and Graph View.

AdditionalNotes.PhysicallyBasedSkyLighting: Set sun and moon values for realistic lighting.
AdditionalNotes.DarkLowerHemisphere: Use terrain or Exponential Height Fog to address dark lower hemisphere.
AdditionalNotes.MultiScattering: Not evaluated for second light source.
AdditionalNotes.TexelsVisible: Increase FastSkyViewLUT resolution if texels are visible.
AdditionalNotes.CameraPosition: Sunlight effect optimized for camera at +Z North Pole. Improvement planned.
HighFrequencyNoise: Use FastSky LUT for high-frequency elements.

SkyAtmosphereComponentProperties.Description: Settings and property reference for the Sky Atmosphere Component.
SkyAtmosphereComponentProperties.Overview: Includes reference information for Project Settings, component properties, console commands, and SkyAtmosphere Material Expressions.

ProjectSettings.Description: Requires extra samplers/textures to apply aerial perspective on transparent surfaces.

ProjectSettings.Property: Support Sky Atmosphere Affecting Height Fog
ProjectSettings.Description: Allows the Sky Atmosphere component to light up the height fog, requires Support Sky Atmosphere to be enabled.

Planet.Description: Controls transform placement and movement in the level.
Options: Planet Top at Absolute World Origin

Planet.Description: Planet radius in kilometers from center to ground level.
Tinting of the atmosphere when sunlight bounces on it.

Atmosphere.Description: Height of the atmosphere above the ground surface in kilometers.
Renders multi-scattering using a dual scattering approach.
Scale of the Atmosphere tracing sample count.

Rayleigh.Description: Rayleigh scattering coefficients at an altitude of 0 kilometers.
Altitude in kilometers at which Rayleigh scattering is reduced to 40%.

Mie.Description: Mie scattering coefficients at an altitude of 0 kilometers.
Mie absorption coefficients at an altitude of 0 kilometers.
Value of 0 means uniform scattering, closer to 1 means more forward scattering.
Altitude in kilometers at which Mie effects are reduced to 40%.

Absorption.Description: Absorption coefficients for another atmosphere layer, approximates ozone distribution.
Absorption coefficients for another atmosphere layer.
Altitude-based tent distribution of absorption particles.

ArtDirection.Description: Scales distances from view to surfaces for thicker aerial perspective.
Scales sky and atmosphere lights' contribution to height fog.
Minimum elevation angle for sun transmittance to ground.
Distance in kilometers to start evaluating aerial perspective.

MaterialExpressions.Description: Outputs sky luminance from interaction with atmospheric lights.
Outputs RGBA-colored in-scattered luminance and transmittance.
Outputs light direction from a Directional Light.
Outputs illuminance reaching skydome world position.
Outputs sky scattered luminance over unit sphere.
Outputs light sun disk luminance with atmosphere transmittance.

ConsoleCommands.Description: Enables rendering of Sky Atmosphere components.
Enables Sky Atmosphere rendering and shader code.
Enables Sky Atmosphere affecting height fog.
Uses full 32-bit per-channel precision for sky look-up tables.
Enables in-editor notification for missing sky dome pixels.
Enables Sky Atmosphere on async compute.
Enables fast sky lookup texture rendering.
Minimum sample count for sky/atmosphere scattering and transmittance.
Maximum sample count for sky/atmosphere scattering and transmittance.
Distance in kilometers for maximum sample count for sky/atmosphere ray marching.
Width of the FastSky LUT.
Height of the FastSky LUT.
Distance to start evaluating aerial perspective.
Enables depth test to improve performance by not writing pixels closer to the camera than StartDepth.
Number of depth slices for aerial perspective volume texture.
Length of the LUT in kilometers.
Sample count per slice for evaluating aerial perspective scattering and transmittance.
Maximum sample count per slice for evaluating aerial perspective.
Width of the AerialPerspective LUT.
Uses low-resolution camera frustum volume for fog on opaque surfaces.

Maximum sample count for sky/atmosphere scattering and transmittance.
Enables sampling of atmospheric lights shadow map for volumetric shadows.
Distance in kilometers for maximum sample count for ray marching the atmosphere.
Enables generation of the sky transmittance LUT.
Sample count for evaluating transmittance.
Uses a small R8BG8B8A8 format for lower quality data.
Enables light per pixel transmittance for opaque objects.
Width of the Transmittance LUT.
Height of the Transmittance LUT.
Sample count for evaluating multi-scattering.
Uses 64 samples for more accurate multi-scattering approximation.
Width of the MultiScattering LUT.
Height of the MultiScattering LUT.
Enables generation of the sky ambient lighting value.
Altitude for sky samples to integrate sky lighting.

SparseVolumeTextures.Description: An asset storing baked simulation data for volumetric media like smoke, fire, and water.

SVTDefinition.Definition: A texture storing texels (voxels) in 3D. Indexed by 3D UV coordinates, saving memory on 'interesting' data regions.

Types.Animated: Sequence of volumes (frames) like flipbook animation.

Composition.Textures: Multiple textures including Page Table and Physical Tile Data textures.
Composition.Attributes: Attributes A and B use RGBA channels for data, up to 8 channels total.

Usage.SVTViewer: Preview and debug SVT assets without setup.

AssetPreview.PerFrameTransforms: Apply frame transforms relative to the viewer component.

Animation.Frame: Scrub frames of the animated SVT.
Animation.Playing: Loop through playback of SVT frames.

Methods: Drag and drop into Content Browser
Use Import button in Content Browser

MaterialInstanceDynamic.BeginPlay: Construct Animated SVT Controller, bind to SVT material parameter.
MaterialInstanceDynamic.Tick: Update controller, apply current frame to SVT parameter.

BlueprintSetup.Example: Setup for volumetric fog, similar for clouds or other actors.

SequencerControl.Track: Add and key AnimationAlpha in Sequencer.

Streaming.Notes: Performance depends on resolution and sparseness. Adjust frame rate, mip level, or pixel format.

Performance.BlockingPlayback: Guarantee all mips are streamed for current frame, useful for offline productions.

Limitations.PageTableSize: Limited to 2GB, max resolution 32k x 32k x 16k.
Limitations.Playback: Depends on data resolution and sparseness, use lower frame rate or resolution.

Supported: Windows DX11, DX12 with SM5, SM6
Platforms.Import: VDB import on Windows editor builds only.

VolumetricCloudComponentProperties.Description: Settings and property reference for the Volumetric Clouds Component.

Layer.LayerBottom: Start altitude in km above ground.
Layer.LayerHeight: End altitude in km above ground.
Layer.TracingStartMaxDistance: Max distance before starting tracing in km.
TracingMaxDistanceMode: Distance from Cloud Layer Entry Point
Layer.TracingMaxDistance: Max distance traced inside cloud layer in km.

Planet.PlanetRadius: Radius used without Sky Atmosphere component.
Planet.GroundAlbedo: Color for cloud lighting from below with sun and Sky Atmosphere.

CloudMaterial.Material: Material describing cloud volume, must use Volume Material Domain.

CloudTracing.SkyLightCloudBottomOcclusion: Occlusion amount for Sky Light at cloud layer bottom.
CloudTracing.ViewSampleCountScale: Scale of view tracing sample count, clamped by scalability setting.
CloudTracing.ReflectionSampleCountScale: Scale of reflection tracing sample count, clamped by scalability setting.
CloudTracing.ShadowViewSampleCountScale: Scale of shadow view tracing sample count, clamped by scalability setting.
CloudTracing.ShadowReflectionSampleCountScale: Scale of shadow reflection tracing sample count, clamped by scalability setting.
CloudTracing.StopTracingTransmittanceThreshold: Stop tracing below this transmittance threshold.

Phase.PhaseG: G input for phase function, range -1.0 to 1.0.
Phase.PhaseG2: G2 input for second phase function, range -1.0 to 1.0.
Phase.PhaseBlend: Lerp factor for blending phase functions, range 0.0 to 1.0.

MultiScattering.MultiScatteringContribution: Contribution of each successive octave, range 0.0 to 1.0.
MultiScattering.MultiScatteringOcclusion: Occlusion reduction for each octave, range 0.0 to 1.0.
MultiScattering.MultiScatteringEccentricity: Phase isotropy for each octave, range 0.0 to 1.0.

VolumetricAdvancedMaterialOutputExpressi.ConservativeDensity: Three component float vector for medium conservative density and extra data.

MultiScattering.MultiScatteringApproximationOctaveCount: Number of octaves for multi-scattering approximation.

Options.GrayScaleMaterial: Use only R channel for gray scale, optimize lighting.

DirectionalLight.AtmosphereSunLight: Directional Light interacts with atmosphere, clouds, sun disk.
DirectionalLight.CastCloudShadows: Light casts shadows from clouds onto other elements.
DirectionalLight.CloudScatteringLuminanceScale: Scales light contribution in cloud media.

SkyLight.CloudAmbientOcclusion: Cloud occludes sky contribution within atmosphere.
SkyLight.CloudAmbientOcclusionExtent: Radius of cloud ambient occlusion map in km.
SkyLight.CloudAmbientOcclusionMapResolutionScale: Scale of cloud ambient occlusion map resolution.
SkyLight.CloudAmbientOcclusionApertureScale: Cone aperture angle for sky occlusion evaluation.

VolumetricCloudComponent.Description: Real-time cloud rendering using volumetric materials.

Features.PhysicallyBased: Material-driven cloud rendering for any type of cloud, adaptable to time-of-day.
Features.Scalable: Supports ground views, flying, and ground to outer space transitions.

RayMarching.Definition: 3D volume texture ray-marched for real-time cloud layers.
RayMarching.Benefits: Supports dynamic lighting, multiple scattering, and cloud shadows.

LightMultipleScattering.Definition: Light rays scatter on particles within the cloud volume.
LightMultipleScattering.Recommendation: Use single octave for games for performance.

CloudOcclusionAndShadowing.RayMarched: Sharp, colored shadows, good for ground to space transitions.
CloudOcclusionAndShadowing.BeerShadowMaps: Support far shadow distances, faster, less accurate.

DirectionalLightInteractions.Benefits: Control strength, distance, and cloud shadowing.

Modes.Mode2: High quality, no cloud-opaque mesh intersection.

SkyLightCapture.Benefits: Distributes capture over multiple frames, optimizing performance.

ConservativeDensityEvaluation.Definition: Optimizes ray marching by evaluating conservative density.
Steps: Evaluate Conservative Density
Decision to Evaluate Main Material

VolumetricFog.Description: Overview of the volumetric fog and lighting options with the Exponential Height Fog Component.

Properties.ScatteringDistribution: Determines directional volumetric scattering (0: equal, 1: light direction).
Properties.Albedo: Reflectiveness of media, close to 1 for water-based particles.
Properties.Emissive: Density of light emitted by fog.
Properties.ViewDistance: Distance over which fog is computed.
Properties.StartDistance: Distance from camera to start fog.
Properties.NearFadeInDistance: Distance over which fog fades in from start.
Properties.OverrideLightColorsWithFogInscatteringCo: Uses Fog Inscattering Colors to override light color.

Properties.CastVolumetricShadow: Toggle volumetric shadow casting for lights.

Local.Materials: Describe Albedo, Emissive, Extinction for points in space.
Local.ParticleSystem: Creates fog density sphere, fully 3D, no billboards.

Features.TemporalReprojection: Smooths aliasing with sub-voxel jitter per frame.
Features.PrecomputedLighting: Volumetric Lightmaps support static lighting for fog.

Performance.Factors: Volume texture resolution, GPU cost of particles, shadow casting lights.

KnownIssues: No support for IES profiles and Light Functions on Point and Spot Lights
No shadowing from Ray Traced Distance Field Shadows
No shadowing from Volumetric Fog itself
No Source Radius on Point and Spot Lights
Some Exponential Height Fog settings have no effect

StrongerLightShaftsWithoutHeavyFog: Keep global fog density low, increase Volumetric Scattering Intensity for Directional Light
Increase density in areas with Volume particles
CommonQuestions.UseWithExponentialHeightFog: Volumetric Fog replaces Fog Inscattering Color within View Distance.

IESLightProfiles.Description: Overview of setting up and using IES textures with lights.
IESLightProfiles.Definition: IES Profiles describe light distribution using real-world measured data. Used in Enterprise fields and games for realistic lighting.

Characteristics.Function: Defines light intensity in an arc for Point, Spot, and Rect Lights.

Example.Profile: ASCII file with metadata about the light distribution.

Steps: Import an IES Profile using available methods.
Select a light and assign the profile to the IES Texture slot in the Details panel.

Options: Use IES Intensity: Uses profile's light brightness.
IES Intensity Scale: Scales profile's brightness contribution.

Properties.Brightness: Light brightness in candelas from IES Profile. Used for masking if less than or equal to 0.

Properties.TextureMultiplier: Multiplier mapping texture value to a result integrated over a sphere to 1.0f.

Visualization.Note: Visualization shown when a light with an IES Texture is selected.

Performance.Note: IES Profiles render fast with minimal performance impact.

SpotLights.Note: Using IES Profiles on Point or Rect Lights turns them into Spot Lights. Spot Light's cones mask the IES effect.

Sources: Photometric viewers like IESviewer for visualization before import.

LightingChannels.Description: Overview of using channels of a light source to light specific surfaces.
LightingChannels.Purpose: Allow dynamic lights to affect objects when their lighting channels overlap, primarily for cinematic use.
LightingChannels.Support: Unreal Engine supports up to 3 lighting channels.

Usage.Default: Directional, Spot, Point Lights, and all Actors have Lighting Channel 0 enabled by default.
Usage.EnablingChannels: Enable the desired channel on both the Actor and the light to affect the Actor.

Example.Description: White Directional Light affects Channel 0 (left mannequin and background), purple Point Light affects Channel 1 (right mannequin).
Example.Properties: Set in the Advanced pulldown menu of the Light category in the Details panel for lights, and in the Lighting category for Actors.

Limitations: Dynamic application only, not for Static Lights or Static Mesh Actors with Static Mobility.
Affects direct lighting on opaque materials only, not translucent or masked materials.

Performance.Impact: Minimal, but non-zero. Example: 0.42ms standard lighting off, 0.53ms with lighting channels on.

Features: Multiple directional lights in different channels.
Each primitive affected by one directional light from the first channel set.
CSM shadows from stationary or movable directional lights cast on matching channels.
Dynamic point lights fully support lighting channels.

LightFunctions.Description: Overview of using materials to mask a light's projected area.
LightFunctions.Definition: Materials applied to filter a light's intensity.
Limitations: Cannot change light color, only Light Color setting can.
Static Lights cannot use Light Functions, only Stationary and Movable lights.

Example.Description: Material uses Panner and ScalarParameter nodes for a flickering effect.

Steps: Set Material Domain to use Light Function attribute.
Apply Light Function to a light in the Details panel under Light Function Material setting.

IssuesAndQuestions.Issue: Light Function only works if cast shadows are enabled.
IssuesAndQuestions.Cause: FScene::AssignAvailableShadowMapChannelForLight only assigns Shadow Map channel to shadow casting lights.

IssuesAndQuestions.Issue: Light Function only works if there's one shadow casting object.

LightShafts.Description: Overview of using Directional Light to simulate light scattering through the atmosphere.
LightShafts.Definition: Light Shafts simulate crepuscular rays and atmospheric shadowing, adding depth and realism.

DirectionalLight.EnableLightShaftOcclusion: Occlude fog and atmosphere in-scattering with screen-space blurred occlusion.
DirectionalLight.OcclusionMaskDarkness: Controls darkness of occlusion masking. 1 results in no darkening.
DirectionalLight.OcclusionDepthRange: Distance from camera within which objects occlude light shafts.
DirectionalLight.EnableLightShaftBloom: Render light shaft bloom from this light.
DirectionalLight.BloomScale: Scales the additive color of the bloom.
DirectionalLight.BloomThreshold: Scene color must exceed this to create bloom in light shafts.
DirectionalLight.BloomMaxBrightness: Rescales brightness larger than this value after exposure.
DirectionalLight.BloomTint: Multiplies against scene color to create bloom color.
DirectionalLight.LightShaftOverrideDirection: Overrides light shaft direction from the light's actual direction.

Methods.OcclusionMethod: Creates a mask from object depths, blurs it away from the light, and uses it to mask fog and atmosphere. Mimics real-life light shafts.
Methods.BloomMethod: Captures scene color around the light source, blurs it radially. Not realistic but controllable and visually impressive.

GPUPerformance.Costs: Occlusion: 0.5ms, Bloom: 0.68ms on a single light at 1080p on a 680GTX. Enable only one to optimize performance.

PhysicalLightingUnits.Description: Overview of using physically based lighting units with light sources in Unreal Engine.
PhysicalLightingUnits.Benefits: Allows for realistic lighting using known, measurable values without 'magic' numbers.

SupportedUnits.DirectionalLight: Direct Normal Illuminance, expressed as Lux (lx).
SupportedUnits.SkyLightAndEmissiveMaterials: Luminance, expressed as Candela per meter squared (cd/m2).

PointSpotRectLights.Description: Luminous intensity emitted uniformly across a solid angle of one steradian.
Luminous flux emitted into the angle of one steradian.
Engine-specific light intensity value for compatibility with pre-UE 4.19 releases.

Components.DirectionalLight: Simulates Direct Normal Illuminance in Lux (lx).
Components.EmissiveSurfaces: Expressed in Candela Per Meter Squared (cd/m2).
Components.SkyLight: Uses pixel intensity multiplied by light intensity, expressed in cd/m2 in HDR.
Components.EmissiveMaterialsAsStaticLights: Uses surface luminance to bake lighting into the scene.

Settings.DetailsPanel: Set Intensity Units to Candela, Lumen, or Unitless in the Details panel.

InverseSquaredFalloff.Description: Physically based distance falloff supported by all three light unit types.

PointSpotRectLights.DefaultSettings: Default unit type can be set in Project Settings > Rendering > Default Settings.

Tips: Increase Auto Exposure Max EV100 if image goes white.
Enable Apply Pre-Exposure or reduce light brightness if reflective surfaces have artifacts.
Use a Post Process Volume to adjust default Post Process settings.
Reconfigure settings when changing to the extended default luminance range.
Reduce Histogram Min and Max range to stabilize auto exposure histogram.

GeneralConsiderations.DefaultValuePropagation: Maintain same light unit for instanced lights to ensure correct propagation of default values.
GeneralConsiderations.ProjectSettings: Specify default Light Units for Point, Spot, and Rect Lights in Project Settings > Rendering > Default Settings.

PrecomputedLightingScenarios.Description: Overview of using multiple lighting setups for a single scene in Unreal Engine.
PrecomputedLightingScenarios.Benefits: Allows dynamic lighting with the fixed cost of pre-computed lighting, useful for VR or Architectural Visualization projects.

Example.DayScenario: Directional Light, Sky Light, and Skybox in Day Scenario level.
Example.NightScenario: Spotlights for streetlights in Night Scenario level.

FeatureLimitations: Only one Lighting Scenario level should be visible at a time.
Lightmap data from all Sublevels placed inside the Lighting Scenario level, preventing streaming by Sublevels.
Sublevel Lightmap data stored in Lighting Scenarios BuiltData package.
Error when loading a sublevel twice without reloading its lighting scenario's BuiltData.

Steps: Open Levels Manager (Window > Levels).
Right-click on a Sublevel in Levels menu, go to Lighting Scenario, and select Change to Lighting Scenario.
Set Level Streaming method to Blueprint by right-clicking on Sublevel, selecting Change Streaming Method, and then Blueprint.
Place lights or Static Meshes into the lighting levels and build each level's lighting.
Open Persistent Level Blueprint, add Load Stream Level (by name) node, and connect to Event Begin Play node.
Input the level name in Load Stream Level node, check Make Visible After Load and Should Block on Load.
Press Play button to launch project with Day level lighting. Change level name for Night level lighting.

Advantages: Ability to change to baked lighting based on project needs

Details.Definition: Simulates lighting interactions with geometry and material surfaces, including absorption and reflectiveness.
Benefits: Mix dynamic and baked lighting in scenes.
Precomputed lighting: ideal for static scenes, lower performance cost, high quality based on texture resolution.
Dynamic lighting: ideal for changing scenes, high performance cost, supports all geometry types.

PrecomputedGlobalIllumination.Description: Uses Lightmass system to precompute lighting data.

Methods.Details: Uses CPU with Unreal Swarm for computing lighting data, can distribute tasks to build farms.
Uses NVIDIA GPU with DirectX 12 and ray tracing.

DynamicGlobalIllumination.Description: Real-time solutions for dynamic indirect lighting.

Methods.Details: Fully dynamic system using ray tracing for next-gen consoles.
Post-processing effect, best used with other methods.
Hardware ray-tracing for dynamic GI, with Brute Force and Final Gather methods.

CPULightmassGlobalIllumination.Description: Features and settings of Lightmass for precomputed lighting.

Lightmaps.Description: Creates lightmaps with complex light interactions.

Communication.SwarmAgent: Manages and distributes lighting builds, tracks progress.

DiffuseInterreflection.Description: Key global illumination effect, controls light bounces based on material BaseColor.

CharacterLighting.Description: Uses Lightmass Importance Volume, affects movable objects via Indirect Lighting Cache.

AmbientOcclusion.Description: Exaggerates indirect shadows for artistic purposes.

MaskedShadows.Description: Considers opacity masks for detailed shadowing.

StationaryLights.BentNormalSkyOcclusion: Directional occlusion for Sky Light with Stationary Mobility.
StationaryLights.DistanceFieldShadowMaps: Maintains shadow shape under lower resolutions.

StaticLights.AreaLightsAndShadows: All Static Mobility lights are area lights by default, control shadow softness.

TranslucentShadows.Description: Light passing through translucent materials creates shadows.

DiffuseTextures.Description: High contrast or dark textures reduce lighting visibility.

Tips: High contrast between direct and indirect areas
Check dark areas on target display

LightmapResolution.Description: Higher resolution improves quality but increases memory and build times.

LightmassSolverQuality.Description: Set based on build quality, higher quality reduces artifacts.

Tips: High resolution for high visual impact areas
Lower resolution for less visible surfaces

LightmassImportanceVolume.Description: Contains high-quality lighting to critical areas.

GPULightmassGlobalIllumination.Description: GPU-based system for generating precomputed lighting data.
GPULightmassGlobalIllumination.Notes: Beta feature, use caution when shipping.

Overview.Description: Precomputes light interactions for Stationary or Static lights, storing data in lightmap textures.
Overview.Technology: Uses DirectX 12 and DXR framework for ray tracing.

Advantages: Allows real-time editing and recalculating lighting.
EnablingSteps: Enable GPU Lightmass in Plugins under Built-In > Editor.
Modify Project Settings for Rendering and Windows categories.

SetupRecommendations.ReducingTDRCrashes: Adjust timeout delay and recovery settings in Windows 10.
SetupRecommendations.DisablingRayTracingFeatures: Use console command or project config file to disable unnecessary ray tracing features.
GPUAndCPUMemory: Ensure enough GPU memory for the entire scene.
Virtual Texture system may require significant memory.
CPU memory needed to store all generated lightmaps.

VirtualTextureLightmaps.Description: Allows for real-time lightmap updates in the viewport.
VirtualTextureLightmaps.Usage: Enable for interactive editing during light builds.

Steps: Enable SLI in NVIDIA Control Panel.
Modify DefaultEngine.ini to allow multi-GPU.
Use command line argument -MaxGPUCount=[n].
MultiGPUSupport.Performance: Improves build times, ideal for architectural and virtual production environments.

FullBake.Description: Renders full lightmap resolution for entire scene.

BakeWhatYouSee.Description: Renders only visible objects, allows real-time editing.
BakeWhatYouSee.Workflow: Updates lighting as changes are made.

SpeedModes.Description: Leverages virtual texturing for real-time updates.

RealtimeMode.On: Slower build due to rendering overhead.
RealtimeMode.Off: Faster build with no rendering overhead.

General: Mode: Full Bake or Bake What You See
